args: Does this describe a specific, new, official action or formal announcement already taken/made by the Trump administration? Answer only "yes" or "no". Trump revokes security clearances for dozens of former national security officials Trump in an executive order on Monday directed the revocation of any active security clearances held by John Bolton, his former national security adviser, and the living signatories of a notorious October 2020 letter suggesting that emails purportedly taken from a laptop belonging to Hunter Biden could be part of a “Russian information operation.” The action all together targets 50 former national security officials, including several former directors of the Central Intelligence Agency. Some of the former officials no longer have security clearances, making the impact of the order unclear. A Bolton representative did not immediately respond to a request for comment. Bolton, a former ambassador to the United Nations, served as Trump’s national security adviser for 17 months, ending in September 2019. In 2020, he published a memoir about his time in the administration that included damaging assessments of the president, portraying him as reckless and unfit for office. In Monday’s order, Trump claimed that Bolton’s book was “rife with sensitive information drawn from his time in government,” an assertion that the former national security adviser has denied. The president has long assailed the signatories of the October 2020 letter, calling the statement a form of “election interference.”
